listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: Situated in a popular and convenient location this spacious 5 bedroom property boasts 2263 Sq ft of accommodation with flexible living space for a growing family. There is scope for refurbishment which would allow a new owner to innovate to suit their own requirements. It is centred around a most impressive sitting and dining room of generous proportions which has a beamed ceiling and a feature gas fire. There is a pleasant conservatory facing the garden and the kitchen could be opened up to make an L shaped kitchen/family room if desired (subject to the usual consents). The five bedrooms are arranged on two floors, most of which face towards the garden and there is also a study with built in storage. The spacious master bedroom and ensuite shower room on the top floor have lovely garden views as well as fitted wardrobes.SituationLocated on a sought-after residential road on the favourable west side of Warlingham convenient for commuting but also with Warlingham Village Green nearby with its range of local shops and restaurants.Caterham is 3.1 miles has a wider range of shops, Church Walk and a Waitrose Supermarket. The M25 is easily accessible four miles away with connections to Gatwick and Heathrow Airports. Local schools include a village primary school in Farleigh Road, Warlingham, Croydon High and Caterham Schools.Train services: Upper Warlingham Station (0.7 miles) is in Zone 6 and provides direct services to London Victoria and London BridgeOutsideThe property is approached via an area of parking with access to two garages at street level. The rear garden is delightful with mature shrubs, flower beds, specimen trees and wild flowers in abundance. Landscaped to follow the contours of the plot, there are seating areas with steps and paths connecting the different parts of the garden making it an exciting garden for youngsters to explore and play. Other garden features include a rose garden, rockery, two greenhouses, shed and vegetable plot. In all the plot is approximately 0.37 acres (0.15 Ha)

listing.description: A completely refurbished, charming two double bedroom period house located on one E14's most popular turnings. A cobblestone street that is steeped in history, Coldharbour is one of the few streets on the Isle of Dogs that has avoided 19th and 20th century development, and as such provides visitors with a wonderful trip back in time.The property itself has undergone a recent refresh, and is offered in immaculate condition. Boasting two spacious & bright double bedrooms with excellent storage features, a modern bathroom and a utility cupboard on the lower floor. Continuing up to the first floor, the open plan reception/kitchen offers an abundance of natural light and benefits and offers an open plan, airy space, which is truly rare to find, this is all perfectly complemented by the breathtaking views of the River Thames that 'hit' you as you come up into the room. The property further opens out onto a private south-facing terrace with more offering more views of the River Thames in its glory.Coldharbour is well-positioned to take advantage of the upcoming Crossrail network when the station opens in December 2018 offering direct links to Central London and Heathrow Airport. The property is also within close proximity to Wood Wharf, the major extension to the Canary Wharf Financial District. Nearby amenities include an array of convenience stores, supermarkets and the Canary Wharf Shopping Centre. The nearby jubilee Line station at Canary Wharf offers access to the West End in less than 20 minutes, whilst the Docklands Light Railway offers links directly to the City.Offered chain-free.

listing.description: An excellent example of the modern and traditional fusion of style, this four-bedroom Victorian house with a driveway makes a formidable claim for the best-refurbished house on the market in the N13 area. With every small detail of the house matriculated to the highest standard, the property offers a chance for a buyer to be the first occupant of this beautiful home.With no shortage of space, the property boasts approximately 1600 sq. Ft. Of internal living space. The property provides a canvass feel, ready for the new owner to come in and blanket as a home.The house is tucked down a quiet residential road with no through access minutes' walk from Palmers Green Station. With a new roof, solid timber doors, bespoke door handles, newly paved driveway, designer radiators, showpiece bathrooms and a Juliet balcony the creative owners have not held back on expenses.Inside, a vanilla cream and calm white colour palate runs throughout the house, which adds to the natural characteristics of light filled floors and space.The second reception is the focal point of the house with floor to ceiling aluminium bi-fold doors and a fully integrated high spec kitchen creating an amazing outlook onto the greens of the landscaped garden.The airy loft room is a fantastic addition the house allowing space for ample storage within the eaves an en-suite bathroom and a traditional Juliet balcony.Wentworth Gardens is a quiet cul-de-sac located directly off Hedge Lane, close to Broomfield Sports Ground and conveniently positioned for the excellent selection of shops, restaurants and transport facilities of both Palmers Green and Winchmore Hill. You will also find the popular Hazelwood School Primary School within close proximity and easy access to St.Monicas Church. The location also provides easy access to the A10 and A406.The property is sold chain free!'Think…Property Inc'

listing.description: A beautiful and contemporary house which has been completely refurbished to a very high standard, all of the period features have been restored and retained. The current owners have done a brilliant job at sympathetically updating the property to create a light, functional & stylish space.The property is larger than the norm for the road, it has a spacious feel throughout and has the added advantage of being an end of terrace, with a south-west facing, low maintenance rear garden that has been landscaped, complete with summerhouse.Internally the property has been completely re-wired, re-plumbed, new bathroom, kitchen (fully integrated), all flooring has been restored and carpets in the right areas namely the landing and stairs.The bathroom features an oversized rainwater shower head, metro tiling, complete with WC and wash basin all in a spacious area.The kitchen complete with tiled floor, butler sink, oak work surfaces and white shaker units leads nicely to the rear garden, or into the open plan dining room complete with exposed brick chimney breast, housing a wood burner, the latter replicated in the reception room, a separate space overlooking the front garden.Upstairs are three double bedrooms with ornate fireplaces, wooden floors and new UPVC sash windows, each room has had new windows throughout.The property is neutrally decorated throughout, the new radiators in each room are stylish, as is the cornicing in the reception; listing.description: Location  Blake Road is a sought after residential road comprising of mostly turn of the century homes.The property is situated less than 5 minutes walk from East Croydon train station, which offers a mainline service into many destinations including London Bridge, Gatwick Airport and London Victoria.Croydon tram link is also nearby and links Wimbledon and Beckenham.Croydon Town Centre is just a short walk from the property and features two shopping centres and a prominent high street that offers many retailers, bars and restaurants.Boxpark is a popular addition to East Croydon and offers pop up eateries serving up different cuisines from all around the world.This property also falls into the catchment areas for excellent, reputable schools.Accommodation  This unique property has been wonderfully refurbished throughout by the current owners, presenting any buyers with an excellent opportunity to simply move straight in.The bungalow is situated on a generous wide plot and benefits from a driveway for several vehicles and access to a detached garage.The accommodation internally briefly comprises entrance porch, a spacious entrance hall with feature fireplace, there are two reception rooms - the dining room has a wonderful open fireplace, perfect for the Winter months and the living room is elegant and offers a dual aspect. The kitchen is modern with fitted appliances and underfloor heating. This leads to a lobby area with WC and access to the rear garden. There are three generous bedrooms as well as a luxury bathroom, also with underfloor heating.This property benefits from high ceilings throughout, double glazing with fitted wooden window shutters giving that elegant touch and wooden flooring throughout the hallway and reception rooms.Outside, the rear garden has been tastefully landscaped to provide a patio area, perfect for entertaining in the Summer months, as well as an area of lawn.An internal viewing is highly recommended.
listing.short_description: A truly magnificent detached bungalow, full of charm and character, situated in a sought after residential road within just a short walk of East Croydon train station. This is a real gem of a property that has undergone a programme of complete refurbishment by the current owners.

listing.description: Having undergone an extensive programme of refurbishment and extension is this impressive, three bedroom semi detached bungalow. The property is ideally located for Petts Wood mainline station, serving an array of London termini. Chesham Avenue is also convenient for a number of local schools including Crofton, St James Primary, Bishop Justus and Bromley High as well as having local shops and regular running bus routes, serving Petts Wood, Bromley and Orpington.The property comprises hallway, three double bedrooms, the master having an ensuite shower room. There is a separate living room, which could be used as a fourth bedroom, a utility room, family bathroom and the delightful, open plan kitchen family room. The kitchen family room boasts a TV/sofa area, dining space and central island with breakfast bar.To the rear is the mainly laid to lawn garden which wraps around the property providing ample out door space. There is also off street parking for two cars.Internal viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate all that this delightful home has to offer.

listing.description: Built by Wren Homes circa 2002, The Personal Agent are delighted to present this attractive and well-proportioned four bedroom detached house located in the ever popular area of Lower Kingswood.The property offers the new buyer a turn key solution with stylish and contemporary design touches and a huge amount of natural light throughout which not only makes the property shine but adds to the welcoming and homely feel too. The existing owners have carried out a comprehensive refurbishment of the property which now enjoys a luxurious style, with flexible accommodation throughout, balanced by ample entertaining space.The well designed accommodation provides the perfect layout for living with defined reception areas that seamlessly flow in to each other in a practical layout that is perfect for entertaining, social occasions and most importantly, day to day life. We are advising immediate inspection to fully appreciate the flexible accommodation as there is no chain and the sale is able to move at speed if desired.The property benefits from a spacious reception hall which provides a great first impression, a large living room to the rear with doors to a secluded patio area and 55ft South/East facing rear garden, dining/family room, study, excellently proportioned kitchen with granite worktops and fitted appliances and a downstairs cloakroom that complete the ground floor.The well proportioned accommodation continues on the first floor with a master bedroom which benefits from an ensuite shower room, three further well proportioned double bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom. There is also access to a useful loft space that offers extra storage and a large frontage that provides ample off street parking.The village of Lower Kingswood is located approximately two miles inside the M25 and offers a choice of local shops, a highly regarded junior school, country pubs and open countryside where many fine footpaths, bridle paths and cycling can be enjoyed. Comprehensive shopping facilities can be found at the vibrant centres of Banstead and Epsom to the north and Reigate to the south.Rail services from Reigate, Tadworth and Kingswood provide services to London Bridge and Victoria, whilst the London to Brighton mainline can be accessed at Merstham. listing.short_description:
Built by Wren Homes circa 2002, The Personal Agent are delighted to present this attractive and well-proportioned four bedroom detached house located in the ever popular area of Lower Kingswood. The property offers the new buyer a turn key solution with stylish and contemporary design touches and a huge amount of natural light throughout which not only makes the property shine but adds to the welcoming and homely feel too. The existing owners have carried out a comprehensive refurbishment of the property which now enjoys a luxurious style, with flexible accommodation throughout, balanced by ample entertaining space. The well designed accommodation provides the perfect layout for living with defined reception areas that seamlessly flow in to each other in a practical layout that is perfect for entertaining, social occasions and most importantly, day to day life. We are advising immediate inspection to fully appreciate the flexible accommodation as there is no chain and the sale is able to move at speed if desired.

The property benefits from a spacious reception hall which provides a great first impression, a large living room to the rear with doors to a secluded patio area and 55ft South/East facing rear garden, dining/family room, study, excellently proportioned kitchen with granite worktops and fitted appliances and a downstairs cloakroom that complete the ground floor. The well proportioned accommodation continues on the first floor with a master bedroom which benefits from an ensuite shower room, three further well proportioned double bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom. There is also access to a useful loft space that offers extra storage and a large frontage that provides ample off street parking.

The village of Lower Kingswood is located approximately two miles inside the M25 and offers a choice of local shops, a highly regarded junior school, country pubs and open countryside where many fine footpaths, bridle paths and cycling can be enjoyed. Comprehensive shopping facilities can be found at the vibrant centres of Banstead and Epsom to the north and Reigate to the south. Rail services from Reigate, Tadworth and Kingswood provide services to London Bridge and Victoria, whilst the London to Brighton mainline can be accessed at Merstham. Often overlooked are the great bus links from Lower Kingwood with a regular service to Gatwick North and South Terminals as well as to London Victoria, both operated by National Express.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: Yopa are happy to offer to the market this extended five bedroom through lounge dining room, semi detached family home set over two floors. The first House of the Famous Sutton Christmas Lighting Lane. The property is served by 24 Hr London bus 93, taking to Morden Underground with bus stop just seconds away. The property has been newly decorated within the past 18 months and is in immaculate, clean condition with new carpets, flooring, bathroom, landscaped garden, garage and is ready to move in without any further work needed.The property comprises entrance hall leading to double through lounge dining room with period features bay window and fireplace. A ground floor bedroom with en-suite and fitted kitchen with high and low level units and integrated oven, hob and dishwasher. There is also a conservatory to the rear of the property which leads out to the private garden.The first floor features an additional four double bedrooms three of which has built-in wardrobes and all are of a good size. There is also a family bathroom equipped with three piece suite (bath, basin and wc).Outside, the property benefits from a landscaped rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn and extends to approximately 70 feet, complete with a large brick paved patio area great for entertaining and ideal for families with children and pets. You will also find a garage at the rear of the garden.Viewings are highly recommended.EPC band: D

listing.short_description: This highly energy-efficient mid-terrace family home, refurbished over the last few years by the current owners, is located in a quiet residential street close to many key amenities. Double-glazed throughout in 2012, it benefits from a new electric fuseboard installed in 2012 and a new boiler in 2015 with all new pipes and new toilet pipes. Smart heating controls the temperature throughout the home. Planning permission to extend the property in the loft for conversion to four bedrooms has lapsed but can be readily renewed if desired. With Kenmont Primary School in the next street, Westfield Shopping Centre at Shepherds’ Bush is just a 5 minute drive away. listing.description: St Ann's PlacePlot BThis stunning bright 4 bedroom terrace House with an abundance of outside space sits within a gated section of this new development. With prestige specification, the handless kitchens have stilestone worktops and under unit lighting. Fitted wardrobes are included to the master bedroom and second bedroom, with a bathroom facility on each floor. Outside the property offers a garden, 1st floor balcony and second floor terrace, secure gated parking is also available.Living room 4.80m x 3.50m 15' 11" x 11' 5"Dining/Kitchen 5.60m x 3.50m 18' 4" x 11' 5"Bedroom 1 4.70m x 3.50m 15' 7" x 11' 5Bedroom 2 4.00m x 3.50m 13' 4" x 11' 5"Bedroom 3 3.50m x 3.20m 11' 5" x 10' 7"Bedroom 4 3.30m x 2.50m 10' 9" x 8' 2"Total Area 115.5 sq.M. 1,243 sq.Ft.Inspired by its surroundings, this development comprises new build and refurbished 1,2 & 3 bedroom apartments and 4 bedroom houses.Located in the heart of the Haringey conservation area in North London, the architects have drawn on the original 1885 style to inspire new build and converted homes that integrate perfectly within the heritage of its surroundings.The look of the original Police Station has been carefully retained, with its arched windows, keystones and stone plaque announcing the building's original purpose.Just across the road from St Ann's Place is the award winning Chestnuts Park. Famous for its avenue of trees, this delightful open area offers a cafe, well equipped modern playground, tennis courts, basketball and preschool center.A short walk from Seven Sisters Station this development is well connected via both the London Overground and London Underground (Victoria Line). listing.description: Blue Estate Agents are proud to bring to market, an immaculately presented three bedroom family home, located in one of Heston’s premier location of Shelly Crescent, TW5. Having undergone complete refurbishment by the current owners, this semi-detached property provides the perfect balance of space and light as well as the perfect access to transport links such as A4, A315, A30 and M4.Upon entering the property, you are greeted with a larger than average hallway which is immaculately presented. Leading from the hallway, you enter a large through lounge which includes wood flooring, large bay window and French doors leading in to the kitchen/diner. The Lounge has been fully renovated to provide ample space to entertain guests, with small modern touches, such as brushed aluminium switches and handles. The French doors greet you in to an extended kitchen and dining space. The modern cupboards, glass splash back and bi-folding doors gives the kitchen a great sense of space and light. The perfect ambiance to cook and dine with family and friends. The added benefit of a separate utility area, shower room and under floor heating helps to complete the ground floor of this property.Upstairs, the property has three large bedrooms as well as a modern bathroom suite. Double bedrooms consist of fitted wardrobes, bay windows and new carpets. The single bedroom also has new carpet fitted. The first floor is flooded with natural light and the décor is both contemporary and modern. The upstairs bathroom further benefits from under floor heating.Outside, The driveway provides parking for two cars and a large alley leads to you a gated entrance to the rear garden. The rear garden has a large decking area for entertaining and a large lawn area thereafter. The garden size is in excess of 100ft.A truly immaculate property which will be the perfect setting for families. Upon entering the property into the large entrance hallway you have a separate reception room with wood flooring, the hallway then continues through to the spacious double reception room with dining area and extended kitchen with direct access to the well maintained garden. Bathroom: (13' 0'' x 8' 5'' (3.96m x 2.56m))

Double glazed opaque window to side. Wet room walk in style shower with glass screen and wall mounted Crosswater controls. Freestanding Contemporary bath tub with wall mounted Crosswater mixer taps. Wall mounted sink unit with wall mounted Crosswater mixer taps. Wall mounted WC with Gerberit Flush. Wall mounted vanity/storage unit. Porcelanosa heated towel rail. Porcelanosa tiles to floor and walls. Underfloor heating.

60’ long with established shrubs. Views over playing fields. Sandstone Patio. High quality Astro turf. Garden office with power and light

Block paved drive with parking for 3 cars.

listing.description: Charming Newly Refurbished Victorian Cottage With Two Bedrooms, Nursery/Study and osp - chain free.The current owners of this enchanting early Victorian cottage have created a bright, stylish living environment - you're going to love it! A huge open plan living space with original detail, contemporary kitchen/diner, two bedrooms, nursery and magic study space make it a fine spot to call home. The decor is picture perfect and the fixtures bespoke and top quality - that staircase! A sunny south east facing garden wraps around to offer side access and there's off street parking too! The location is inimitably peaceful yet well connected. Tucked away in a wonderful period enclave of similarly charming properties, Halifax Street sits but moments from the amenities of Kirkdale Village. Sydenham and Forest Hill are each walkable in around 10 minutes - that's bars, eateries and transport taken care of!The property sits at the quiet end of a quiet street - it's mature, friendly and incredibly peaceful. Your exterior is quaint and charming with London stock brick work and original period detail. Enter the building on the left hand side directly into your wonderful reception which runs 25 ft from tip to toe. Recrafted original timber floors, original multi pane sash windows, lacquered school house radiators and a wood burning stove tell you you're home! White wash brickwork on the chimney breasts gives a slick New York loft vibe. You'll comfortably seat a banquet for dinner and there's a generous lounging space to the front of the space.Wide steps lead down from the rear to your bright, modern kitchen where opposing rows of cabinets and counters house a ceramic sink and drainer, integrated dishwasher, washing machine and super five ring gas range. Your garden is accessed from here - it's a lovely spot to enjoy some chill out time. Your impressive solid oak stairs lead upward from the reception. A glass screen allows for plenty of light to gush down from your huge Velux window. A further side aspect casement window supplies the study / office space with yet more light - it's a great space to get that cottage industry going.A further half flight ascent leads up to your bedrooms, the master of which fronts the street into the full width of the building. The chimney breast has a lovely, exposed bright alcove. A neat single room / nursery comes next along the hall with a side aspect sash window. The second bedroom will fit a small double bed and peers over surrounding leafy gardens. Your bathroom is modern and well stocked with a quality white suite, heated towel rail, bath and rear aspect frosted sash. Your loft offers a large storage space - it's almost head height and covers the foot print of the living area.A 10 minute walk will have you at either Sydenham or Forest Hill stations, with fast and regular services to London Bridge and Victoria. Just down the road, Forest Hill has a library, swimming pool (and gym) and many lovely boutique shops and cafés. Eating out? Go no further than round the corner for an excellent Japanese meal at Hibagon Sushi and Grill or relax and enjoy organic and New World wines at 161 Kirkdale. Sydenham Wells Park and Crystal Palace Park are within easy reach for a walk or a picnic!

listing.letting_fees:
Once we have agreed terms for a tenancy, we will require payment of a non-refundable £175 tenancy administration fee per tenant (each adult to be resident in the property), covering all referencing, preparation of the tenancy agreement and associated administration relating to commencement of tenancy, together with a £200 reservation fee which will be credited to your initial rental on commencement of tenancy

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.
listing.description: Guide price £685,000 - £700,000jdm are delighted to offer this individually built and truly stunning, four bedroom detached family home to the market. Located on a pleasant residential street, this property has been meticulously refurbished and completed with a modern finish. It is ideally located for various bus routes and is a short walk from Petts Wood mainline station. Lovelace Avenue is also convenient for a number of local schools including Crofton Infants and Primary, St James Primary, Bishop Justus and Bromley High, as well as having a number of local shops, parks and recreational grounds.The accommodation comprises a light and welcoming entrance hallway hosting a downstairs cloakroom. The open plan living/dining area features dual aspect windows with the lounge at the front and the rear offering a modern kitchen/diner which overlooks the garden.To the first floor there are four bedrooms, two of which are doubles and a further two good sized singles, with the master featuring built-in wardrobes and a cleverly designed and concealed en-suite. There is also a spacious family bathroom featuring a freestanding bath and separate shower.To the rear is a manageable garden with lawn and patio area, while the front has off-street parking and a single garage.Internal viewing comes highly recommended to fully appreciate all this family home has to offer.

listing.description: Set in the popular Dover House Conservation area is this beautiful, well proportioned house situated close to Putney Heath and Richmond Park. The house offers a recently refurbished kitchen which maximises its space and creates a wonderful central hub overlooking the 70ft garden. There is a separate reception room with log burner overlooking the front garden and upstairs has two double bedrooms, the master with an ensuite. There are numerous bus services a short walk away as well as Barnes mainline station giving frequent access in to Waterloo. Access in and out of London by road is serviced by the A3 and M4.

listing.description: Housesimple is happy to present a 4 bed terraced house in Richmond/Ham with no onwards chains in a quiet residential area close to the river Thames and Ham House. The marvellous surroundings are family friendly with lots of green, recreation areas along the river, well served by schools, nurseries and shops in walking distance. Outstanding schools such as the Tiffin Girls School, Grey Court School and the German School are close by.The house, built in the late 50s, with front and rear garden, is full of light and fitted with double glazing windows and hard wood flooring throughout. A full refurbishment has transformed the house to modern standards.The house is accessed passing through an open front garden area with flower beds along the edges and hard surface paving for two potential parking spaces. The porch leads to an entrance area with black natural slate flooring, double build-in wardrobe and classic timber stair. The entrance hall communicates with kitchen and living room and provides access to the sleeping quarters. Additional storage area is found under the stair.The contemporary kitchen with slate flooring, overhead downlight and real timber work top is fitted with electric oven/hub and gas cooker. Space for a fridge freezer and washing machine is provided for. A Vailant boiler provides heating and hot water and is sized to service also the roof area.A large wall opening connects the kitchen to the living room forming a continuous space. The living room with natural oak flooring, french window doors to the garden terrace and large window to the road presents a fire place.Four bed rooms, three double and one single, are located on the first floor together with one bathroom. All bed rooms with oak flooring are accessed from a stair landing which is naturally illuminated by a glass headers above the doors. The master bedroom with plenty of space for a large wardrobe and a double bedroom are facing the road. The second double bedroom, a single bedroom and the bathroom face the garden.The loft is spacious and could be extended to 2 bedrooms and one bathroom (stpc). Hot and cold water as well as elelectricity has been laid up to the roof.The rear garden with a large terrace, new lawn, flower beds and a large tree is accesible from the road through a shared passage way and from a garden gate located jat the end of the property. A garden shed with two separate storage units provides space for bikes and garden utilities.The property gives the opportunity for a front and rear extension (stpc).This attractive family home offers a comfortable and well balanced accommodation in a save and well serviced neighbourhood.

listing.description: A large, and well-proportioned three or four bedroom end-of-terrace family home in sought-after Lower Clapton. Over 1,600sqft of internal space is split across three floors of this stunning late-Victorian freehold house. Historic features promoting the character of the property include bay windows, high ceilings, and decorative plaster cornicing. Nonetheless, the home has been subject to interior refurbishment, and also includes modern facilities; recently improved central heating, double glazing, kitchen, and bathroom. The property further benefits from an expansive garden to the rear. Experienced developers will note that nearby properties have been extended.The property is very well positioned in Lower Clapton; one of London’s most in-demand environments. Nearby rail (Clapton Station, Hackney Central Tube), and bus links allow local residents to commute into and out of town with ease. East London’s trendy bars, fine dining, independent vintage boutiques, and organic shops are nearby, too, and London’s famous pop-up eateries, cafes, and cinemas appear locally from time-to-time. Rushmore Road is also within reach of good local gyms, supermarkets, and places of worship.
listing.short_description: Comprising over 1,600sqft of internal space. A three or four bedroom end-of-terrace home on Rushmore Road in desirable Lower Clapton. Includes basement, garden, and Utility. Cul-de-sac location. Development opportunity for an experienced investor
